page.title: 12Farming B: Land Use
page.content:
Much of the land is used for the grazing of sheep and cattle and the rest of the grass is used for hay, silage or haylage, being cut either two or three times a year.
Some farmers plough a few of their fields and plant cereals such as barley, oats and wheat. Swedes are also grown as a cash crop on certain farms.
Most residents and landowners use part of their land as kitchen gardens providing themselves with and all year round supply of vegetables such as potatoes, leaf greens, broad and runner beans, peas and root crops as well as a variety of soft fruits.
Apple trees grow well and most farms have their own small orchards.
